I am aware that the study tested 'theoretically motivated measures of language impairment,  reading and spelling ability, and short-term verbal information storage and manipulation'… in the discussion it refers to what they tested as 'language acquisition' so I have gone with LA as the primary IV

I have coded 5 because the journal says '...Therefore, some participants will have been tested
on IQ several years before or after their reading and language
measures were collected…'
The actual sample contained twins an their non-twin siblings aged from 12.3 to 25.1 years (mean = 17.9, SD = 2.9),
